snippet: While China is eager to wean itself from energy imports and coal, its extraction of shale gas is likely to be more expensive and dangerous than elsewhere.
abstract: China, eager to ween itself from energy imports and coal, is pursuing shale gas extraction project that is likely to be more expensive and dangerous than elsewhere in world; explosion at fracking facility in Jiaoshizhen has highlighted concerns; energy giant Sinopec is pursuing project despite conditions that force workers to dig three times as deep as their counterparts in the United States.
lead_paragraph: While China is eager to wean itself from energy imports and coal, its extraction of shale gas is likely to be more expensive and dangerous than elsewhere.

headline.main: China Takes On Big Risks in Its Push for Shale Gas
headline.print_headline: China Takes On Big Risks in Its Push for Shale Gas
